greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=1 for n <= s+k; thereafter a(n) = Sum(a(n-i-s-a(n-i-1)),i=0..k-1) where s=0, k=5.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Joseph Callaghan, John J. Chew III, and Stephen M. Tanny, On the behavior of a family of meta-Fibonacci sequences, SIAM Journal on Discrete Mathematics 18.4 (2005): 794-824. See Eq. (1.7).
mathematica: s = 0; k = 5; a[n_] := a[n] = If[n <= s + k, 1, Sum[a[n - i - s - a[n - i - 1]], {i, 0, k - 1}]]; Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 10 2017 *)
xref: Callaghan et al. (2005)'s sequences T_{0,k}(n) for k=1 through 7 are A000012, A046699, A046702, A240835, A241154, A241155, A240830.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 16 2014
